result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael B Kloth

defendant.name: Kloth, Michael B
defendant.address: 5110 North Port Washington Road, Building, Glendale, WI 53217

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael B Kloth appeared by video.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii appeared by video for Michael B Kloth.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  State is in compliance with victim notification.
Discussion held. Defendant has a felony matter (22CF2882) in Branch 16 and will be seeking a global offer and request the court to authorize transfer.
Court authorizes transfer to Branch 16 for purposes of a global resolution, if accepted.   
Case remains calendared in Branch 15.
Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Michael B Kloth in court.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii appeared by video for Michael B Kloth.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in Court for Calendar Call. DEFENDANT APPEARS. Court canceled stayed bench warrant. 
Discussion held to determine the posture of the case. Defense counsel in receipt of discovery and offer and  requests a scheduling date. Case adjourned back to Branch 15.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Calendar call on September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael B Kloth not in court.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Calendar call scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Christopher R. & LaQuinta Inn at 5423 N Port Washington Rd
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Michael B Kloth in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Michael B Kloth in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael B Kloth appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/29/22 @ 2p
